Review: Hey, gabapentin has done wonders for me. I can clearly feel the difference between not taking it and taking it. In school my anxiety is a big problem, I couldnt even look at my classmates, it felt like my body was locked and I couldnt speak or look elsewhere than my pc. When using gabapentin these problems is just gone, Im happy, concentrated and very energetic. It is the best

I am someone who has a whole laundry list of problems (bipolar II with psychotic features, depression, generalized anxiety, ADHD, panic disorder, and dpdr) so that means I have to take a ton of medication and have been in therapy since I was 13. I just started gabapentin at 300 mg 3x a day and my anxiety is almost nonexistent. I used to be absolutely paralyzed by fear at random points during the day for seemingly no reason. To the point that all of my muscles would tense and I would feel like they are on fire. This is the only medication that has helped.
Works amazing combined with venlafaxine. It seemed to help overall but taking the two medicines together created amazing clarity and concentration
Helps tremendously with anxiety as well as depression.
I am just now learning gabapentin helps people for so many different issues. Me personally I call it (My little miracle pill)!

I too went through the awful nightmare  when I quit gabapentin.  In the past I have quit xanax, alcohol, cocaine and a few others and those drugs were a cake walk compared to gabapentin.  I have never felt such anxiety and hopelessness.

I am prescribed 300mg a day but can take up to 600mg. I noticed mood stabilization and anxiety riddance by day 4 or 5. The first week I was extremely high on this medication I even left my phone in a Chinese tea shop and had to turn around no joke. I am now enjoying living on campus at ASU and am getting out more by myself. It is helping me more than my benzo script ever did and Im in a low dosage! I got a fever as a side effect when I first started but now it is gone.

No bad side effects. The best drug for anxiety next to Ativan. The only weird, but enjoyable side effect was Closed Eye Visuals or CEVs.  I would wake in the middle of the night and with my eyes closed, I would see beautiful brightly colored patterns, which I would enjoy until I drifted off to sleep again.  I take 600mg 3x per day.

On gabapentin 1 month now.  300 mgs 3 x a day,  off label for anxiety.  So many side effects!!  Blurred and double vision, falling, memory gaps, diarrhea, way too hungry, 12 hour sleeps, ears ringing, and now hands and feet tingling and numb.  Horrible!  Dropped to two doses a day 10 days ago.  Felt better but the tingling had started last 4 days.  Dropped to one dose as of yesterday and going to stop altogether in a couple of days.  Only been a month so not worried about withdrawal, and its been gradual enough.  Yes, it knocked out anxiety, but the side effects arent worth it.

I've struggled with moderate to severe generalized anxiety for all of my life - mostly related to social and performance situations. I've tried many different drugs and have never been sure that they worked. Then I was prescribed Neurontin, and I can 100% feel the difference. My anxiety has decreased significantly on this drug. It sedates me nicely to the point that I'm still completely alert and myself, but I'm so much more easygoing and relaxed. My physical symptoms related to anxiety are still there but I feel less anxious about them, if that makes sense. It just makes the world much more bearable. There are some negative side effects - such as low sex drive, dizziness (which went away after taking for a few weeks), and sometimes I get extra teary. But it's not much of a price to pay if it helps with the main demon of anxiety!  Drugs affect everyone differently, but if you think your life is negatively affected by anxiety, it's definitely worth trying.

My doctor put me on Gabapentin due to daily headaches. I felt absolutely wasted for the first 3 weeks. Once that had worn off I cant say it helped my symptoms at all. I had awful nightmares, night sweats and the most intense anxiety Ive ever felt. Im now coming off the drug and its tough. I wouldnt recommend this for a long term fix or at all to be honest. It is different for everyone though.

I was rediagnosed after suicidal behavior had me on a hold. I was placed on 400mg 3x daily. The sleeping medication my doctor wished to have me on was denied by insurance and I began to take an extra dose before bed, making sure my psychiatrist knew I'd improvised. She agreed to change my script since it was working. The difference in my life has been incredible. I feel very little anxiety, my behavior is much less problematic interpersonally, and my productivity is through the roof. I'm also on bupropion 300mg XR. I've had almost no side effects. My cravings for alcohol are gone. I'm actually living for the first time in my adult life. The only thing that worries me is the possibility of withdrawal symptoms but it's worth the risk considering the effect it's had.

Took 300mg gabapentin one time for panic attacks and anxiety. My psychiatrist prescribes this to use when anxious symptoms became severe. After several hours I do feel that it helped my anxiety briefly, however I became very drowsy. Once falling asleep I slept very well! Better than most nights. I did wake up around 3am with tremors and hot flashes. My anxiety was full blown and I debated whether to take a Xanax to calm myself down because it was so severe. Made me feel very dizzy, hot, anxious, and made my muscles tense. The rest of the morning I had increased anxiety compared to normal. I will not be taking again. Many reviews state it helped people and wish I could have been so lucky.

I was prescribed neurontin for pudendal neuralgia. I gradually increased from 100 mg three times daily to 300 mg 3x a day. I also take 60 mg duloxetine and 20 mg buspar 2x daily. While my neuralgia didnt improve, it left me feeling great from reduced anxiety. However, I had to discontinue using it because it significantly impaired my ability to drive safely- I had two near car accidents in two days; and it caused major abdominal bloating in the evening. I am extremely disappointed as I felt better emotionally than I have in years.

I started taking gabapentin, 300 mg 3 times a day, about a month ago.  At first it did a lot for my anxiety, although I experienced a lot of side effects:  dizziness, bloating, weight gain.  I was able to cut way back on my ativan use.  However, the last week my anxiety has shot through the roof and I have had to take gabapentin about every two hours instead of four.  The side effects have subsided, though.  I am going to ask my therapist this Friday whether I should increase my dose or try to get off this drug.

I just started Gabapentin 600mg per day. Not sure if the dosage is low but not experiencing the relief I expected. I don't feel dizzy or nauseous like other medications but I still need my Klonopin to ease the panic attacks. I look forward to this new medication. I'll keep you updated in the near future. By the way, the optimal dose for anxiety is 900 to 1,800mg. But if a lower dose helps you then stick with it. Good Luck to everyone. I hope you find relief from anxiety.

gabapentin works differently for everyone. I took it for anxiety but only  temporarily because of concentration issues. I took 100mg every 6 hours and it helped me for a while. Currently, my anxiety is under control, but my mood is down. A combo of an antidepressant and gabapentin is a perfect match, but it doesn't work for everyone. It will either work or won't. The great thing about this medication is that you don't have to wait several weeks for it to work. It usually works immediately but if your anxiety is high then give it at least a week and at the right dosage for it to work. Some people can handle 300mg and some people need 1,800mg to be effective. Give it a chance before quitting.

I wasted time with talk therapy and antidepressants.  Then by chance  I took gabapentin for pain when I got shingles.  I noticed that my generalized anxiety went away.  I also sleep a lot better.  I take 200 mg in the morning and 200mg at night.  I had to get used to it - it made me feel fuzzy brained at first. Before gabapentin  I used to like to have a cocktail to calm my nerves.  Now drinking alcohol doesn't even sound good.  I feel calm.  Why isn't this prescribed more?  I had to ask for it.

This definitely helps my social anxiety. Sometimes I don't want to shut up! (lol) However, I don't believe that this will help people with SEVERE anxiety and depression. Anti-depressants would probably work better. I think Gabapentin is more for people who have social anxiety disorder, at least through my experience. It also helps me with my alcohol cravings. My psychiatrist in rehab prescribed me Gaba 2 years ago and I've been on it ever since. I take 600-900mg a day.
gabapentin has been excellent for anxiety

Started off at 300mg 3 x a day for anxiety, depression and insomnia. Didnt really do much at that level so the psychiatrist increased it to 400mg 3x a day and then upped it to 400mg 4x a day. I used to be on lorazepam for anxiety but stopped taking that because of the side effects. I can tell you with 100% confidence that Im feeling better on Gabapentin than anything Ive ever been prescribed for anxiety and depression. Ive also been sleeping through the night uninterrupted, which I havent been able to do for the past 20 years. This stuff works people, as long as its at the right dose for your personal needs.
Gabapentin is fantastic for anxiety

This medication gabapentin has been AMAZING for my panic disorder. Within two days of starting gabapentin 300mg x 3 daily I saw incredible improvement. I have had my middle of the day dosage upped to 900mg only because that is when I experience the most anxiety. Only downfall is withdrawal symptoms. I went a couple of days without due to not being able to get my prescription filled and the withdrawal was awful. Shaking, chills, confusion, etc. If you do choose to get off of the medication, follow your doctor's directions and taper off gradually.

Tried gabapentin at several doses for anxiety. Felt nothing from the 100mg/3x day that my doctor started me at, so we upped it 200mg/3x day. I couldn't tell for certain whether it was making anxiety worse or still having no effect until we upped it to 300mg/3x day when I knew that it was making me feel spacey, disconnected and overall more anxious and unable to focus and think straight.

I'll give gabapentin a 5 because it works insanely good for my neuropathic pain, but for my anxiety I don't know. I just can't find the right dosage. I've been on everything from 1200mg to 600mg. 600mg worked well for about three months, but suddenly 600mg stopped working and is now giving me anxiety. I tried to up the dose, but it didn't work. Now I'm trying to lower the dosage, but it also gives me anxiety. I'm tired of not getting the right dose. It is a lot of anxiety and it feels pretty hopeless. I'm now gonna try to taper down slowly to about 300mg's because I see a lot of people that use it for anxiety at that dose. I just want minimal pain and to be calm...

I had a nervous breakdown (lots of anxiety and depression), ended up in the ER and was given gabapentin three X 100 mg a day (about 2 months ago). It worked immediately; with in an hour of my first dose I had a big appetite (had lost 10 pounds), a big mood lift and a boost in energy. The side effects (grogginess and confusion) were gone in less than a week.  It worked really well for about a month and then I felt it starting to wear off. My pdoc doesn't believe higher doses will benefit me so need to find something else.  I agree with others that the effects wear off after a while and bigger doses may be needed, but I really liked it and it worked very well for depression where my other meds (ativan and propanolol) did not.  Even though I feel it's worn off, I am still not as bad as I was (I believe it is still helping somewhat). Overall, it worked well for me but it may not be a good option if something long-term is needed.

Eh. I tell myself it works, so I think that helps. Psych scared of anti-anxiety meds so he scripts anticonvulsants off label. Seems to work better PRN. If I take it on a regular basis I get fatigued and shaky. This drug relieves my anxiety as much as Benadryl, without causing the sleepiness so that's a plus. Seems to help in acute social situations to take the edge off. I think it helps my chronic back pain a bit, but that could be my imagination. I give it a 6 because side-effects are mild, the drug is cheap, safe, and at my disposal.
Gabapentin was prescribed for my anxiety, was also suffering from depression at the time. Experienced near instant  relief after first 100 mg dose kicked in. Good stuff.

After several years of taking increasing doses of several other anti-depressants with diminishing results, my psychiatrist diagnosed me with treatment-resistant/atypical depression (along with the anxiety). I was kept on Wellbutrin, and gabapentin and remeron were added in. It was one wild ride. I felt so loopy and out of it, but I felt completely emotionally dead and empty. It was quite scary. I spent an hour once just slowly pacing my hallway and then staring into space. They cut my dosage, but the side effects were still just too much. Once I cut the gabapentin completely, the side effects were gone.

Gabapentin is great! 300mg x2 daily All my anxiety is gone, the pain on my neck, shoulders and legs as well. Finally, I found the right medication after trying so many different prescription's for my anxiety. I give it a solid 10!

It only kinda worked the first time I used it but I must say that I think it worked better that time due to the fact that I didn't sleep the night before (as in 0 hours of sleep). I took it again the next day and I didn't feel any different. I was still as tense and as anxious as ever. I wish people would quit demonizing the other pills. Maybe then people like me who really need them could get our hands on them BUT nooo people keep abusing those pills so now you've got all these hurdles people like me gotta get over in order to get a medicine that actually works. Gabapentin isn't very effective at all. For me it did absolutely nothing.

Been on 3600mg past couple years. I read notes of everyone's personal experience with it for anxiety, but I see it's so different for everyone. I have schizoeffective disorder. It helps with the anxiety part and the depressive part, but I can tell it must be noticeable to other's if i'm on it because some acquaintance I've known thru my wife really have dramatically different interaction with me now compared to before I was on this. Very distant to me now. On other hand, it's more important for mySELF. But it has worn off a lot if i take it every day. I'm so depressed during those periods. It's a trough. Would be even less depressed if I wasn't on it at all, but then I would not have the up swings with it either. It's very difficult to manage it.

If there is one word to describe this drug, it would be 'HORRIBLE'! I am taking 100 mg of this gabapentin poison twice a day and the side effects are not like anything that I have EVER experienced before. Insomnia, anxiety, visual disturbances and nightmares when I do sleep. I just stay in my room on the bed night and day. Concentration loss and have lost all interest in everything. I attempted to stop taking it and the withdrawal started 14 hours after my last dose. When I call the DR, he tells me these symptoms are not from the poison. WHAT! They started a few days after I started it. Some how, some way, I must stop this vile substance.

Been on gabapentin for over 10 years.  It helps with certain parts of anxiety, mainly tension and irritability.  However, and I swear some Psychs don't get this, you have to take it religiously every 4-5 hours for it to work.  If I got past that mark, my shoulders and back tense up, everything annoys me, and I start to hate everything.  Sounds tough, but it hasn't affected my organs negatively, and when taken properly, it works.
I think its helping. Hard to say, as I am on a lot of other meds that are helping me feel better. Either way, Im not vomiting from anxiety anymore and I can eat  so it mustve done something!

I first started Gabapentin to address severe anxiety and depression as well as a drinking problem. At first this drug was a miracle. for about a year-and-a-half I told everybody that this drug saved my life. I wasn't drinking, it had reduced depression, and almost no anxiety. However, over time I started to notice that if I didn't take the medication within four or five hours of my last dose I would have temporary withdrawal. This includes sweats, extreme irritability and anxiety, and an inability to focus. As mentioned in many other posts, it does very noticeably affect your memory. So while immediately helpful, in the long-term I have developed a dependency on this drug and experience withdrawal symptoms on a day-to-day basis which is difficult to manage. I've been on this drug for over 2 years, with all different dosages, and I want to get off it now. It is an amazing temporary fix but leads to dependency and other mental stress.

I have been originally on only 300mg to help me sleep about 3 years ago. I did help a bit. But since then, I've been on about 3200mg per day past couple years. I usually end up taking most of that if I have to go somewhere, like a public place such as a house event etc..almost anything really. It doesn't last nearly as long as it did in the beginning. Now, about 2 hours or slightly more and it seems done. After that I start feeling depression and anxiety creep in. I take the other remainder at night but even that's not enough now to help me sleep. I get zero sleep. Probably an hour per WEEK past many years actually. Sounds impossible but it's true. I'm wide awake all night. I have always had that though, but the anxiety caused by the temporary withdrawal of the Gabapentin doesn't help I'm sure.

Took them to feel good at first really helped me. Being in recovery it got me threw a lot of hard times thinking about getting high on heroin it pushed me threw to stay off dope another day. But recently I took them one sat night as usual and I started getting these weird jolts and uncontrollable movements ultimately ended up having a seizure in the hospital. Now I cant take them any more the make me feel weird and uncomfortable to the point where it puts me in a anxiety attack. I do not recommend them for anyone horrible drug used for the wrong reasons. One 300mg a day is it nothing more. .....just my experience

I would give gabapentin a higher rating when it comes to nerve damage but for anxiety, I dont notice it doing a single thing. Ive been taking  this along with opioids for chronic pain for awhile and we tried upping it and decreasing benzos for anxiety but it never helped me with anxiety. Ill stick to the benzos. But try this before a benzo please!

I have just started taking gabapentin for anxiety.  It took less than a week for me to start feeling better on this drug. It seems to have completely removed my anxiety. Here is the weird part... I am only using gabapentin at a 100 mg dose and it works for anxiety.   I have to state though, I take high dose of Cymbalta (90mg dose) and Adderall (40mg dose) Those two drugs take care of my depression and lack of focus. So maybe that is why I am responding so well to such a small dose of gabapentin. I am supposed to go up another  100 mg in a few days. I may wait stay at this dosage for a while and see if it continues to work for me.

My doctor tried gabapentin along with 60 mg Cymbalta for my severe anxiety/panic disorder. On 300 mg per day, I could not keep my eyes open and kept nodding off. It did not help my anxiety it just made me feel sleepy and spaced out like I was on morphine or heroin. I could not work, drive, or function at all on this drug. I nearly wrecked my car and people thought I was on drugs. However, the same combination helped my mom tremendously with her depression and neuropathy. She had no side effects.

I have been on gabapentin for roughly 2 years and it has helped me, I have bipolar disorder and nothing had worked. I was constantly depressed. So my doctor put me on this. I also take Pristiq which is also good. I am also on lamatrigine. This is a great combination. At the beginning I was loopy but after my body got used to it I was living my life like everyone else.

Id been on Gabapentin a few times in the past for anxiety. This time they gave it to me for bipolar?!! Im struggling with this, taking 2400mg (top dose) mg/day. My memory is gone. Long term memory fine, short term gone. I cant sit and watch TV without extreme anxiety, getting up every 10 min, crossing and uncrossing legs, squirming. I had to get an excuse from jury duty saying I was unfit. .. all I can do is wager this time against the last times and remember how hard it was for me to even cook a meal, how it would take me 3 hours. Now I dont cook at all. Im too exhausted all the time. But coming off of it I feel extremely depressed (lay in bed ALL day) unable to sleep, etc. This drug also causes pancreatic cancer. Which my father in law died from. Help me get off this mess!!!! Im trapped.

Gabapenin let's me LIVE LIFE!! I have HORRIBLE social anxiety, it has made me miss many important moments in my sons life because I get too scared and nervous to leave the house.  Xanax and klonopin both helped to a small degree, but it was still hard for me to do simple things like go to a store.  Then my doctor prescribed me gabapentin and all I can say is it is AMAZING for social anxiety!   I highly, highly recommend to anyone with social anxiety.  It changed my life.

I was prescribed 100mg 4x per day for anxiety and  it worked at first. Then needed higher dosages, then came the side effects  of loss of memory, confusion, suicidal ideations and physical dependency.  I lost my job because I can't keep up with the pace of work and the increased depression. The withdrawals trying to taper off it are horrible. If there is another option rather than gabapentin I would consider it.

At first I thought gabapentin was great, it seemed like it was helping with my anxiety and I had zero urge to drink alcohol for the first time in forever.  Only problem is that after a few months I turned into a ZOMBIE!  I felt foggy all the time.  I had trouble waking up in the morning and always felt like I had this nasty headache.  It got hard for me to remember things; I could have conversation with someone and not remember what it was about an hour later.  I had to stop taking it because it was affecting my work; I was constantly spacing things and forgetting to, y'know, do my job.  The withdrawal was BAD. I experienced increased anxiety and feeling creepy-crawly sensation on my skin for several days.  Wish it worked out better for me because the original effects were great.

I have been on gabapentin for almost a month now. I am clinically diagnosed with PTSD, and major depressive disorder. I have had a very traumatic child so of course I suffer with anxiety related to PTSD. I cannot function in my day to day life without medication and I have to accept that.  Along with gabapentin 100mg 3 times daily for anxiety, I also take celexa for depression, Prazosin, and Trazodone for nightmares and sleep. My doctor is resistant to benzodiapenes, though I feel I need them, never been an addict. I have tried Busbar and vistaril with no luck. Doc suggestion gabapentin. When I take it within the hour I feel relaxed and my thought process slows down. I had had racing thoughts daily before this. I am not crippled in my day to day life with anxiety that prevents me from functioning. I do feel like I could benefit from higher dose as I feel like my body is adjusting to the medication and not giving me the effect it originally had the first week. But all in all, I have no complaints.
Gabapentin has really helped my anxiety and alcohol over use, and not addictive like Xanax. Helps my insomnia as well
Weak orgasms and loss of self. I was given 200mg for anxiety, depression, and partial seizures. For two weeks I felt like I was in a dark place and felt dull. I wouldn't recommend.

Gabapentin made me cry uncontrollably - I was on it for my anxiety. It gave me dark  thoughts and I felt buzzed,  weak, drained, and a worthless feeling. I almost ended up in the psychiatric hospital.

I was originally put in this drug to get off of benzodiazepines. I realized it was helpful with my anxiety somewhat as well. My doctor decided it may be in my best interest to continue taking this medication for a while. Unfortunately I started to have severe swelling in the abdomen and insane water retention in my hands, face, and neck. I put on about 15 lbs in a matter of two and a half months, which ultimately led to me coming off of this medication. Within the first 24 to 48 hours my body was in full blown water ridden.

I usually rate medications low because of side effects and non-ease of use. However, I am very impressed with this medication.  It goes in, does what it is needed for and didnt impair me to where I was non functional which has been the case with a lot of other medications for me. Gabawesome!

My doctor suggested I get off Klonopin and he put me on Gabapentin. It has helped tremendously with anxiety before bedtime. The best way I can describe it is I suddenly feel calm and dreamy and like I can turn my mind off and finally stop over thinking. Much in the way a benzodiazepine would make me feel, but without feeling too dizzy or like I'm losing my memory. Another thing it has helped with is to slow down my drinking. I use to drink before bedtime to help me fall asleep (which has its side effects, but I felt it was better than tossing and turning all night)... The Gabapentin actually turns off that craving somehow and I don't desire any sort of drink before bed. I also somehow quit smoking. The one thing I can tell you Gabapentin does NOT work with are things like panic attacks. Taking a Gabapentin during a panic attack will probably do nothing, in comparison to a benzodiazepine. It will reduce anxiety in a more general sense though.

This drug changed my life . I have had terrible anxiety my whole life which was followed by depression. SSRI's had little effect. I finished my degree and actually got a job.  For anxiety you need a higher dose , I started with 100mg x 3 and worked up to 1800mg a day, the sweet spot.  Few things I will warn others , the withdraw is pretty bad . I ran out 3 days before refill and begged the pharamacist to refill it 2 days early. As well , sometimes its difficult to get a good erection. My  psychiatrist gave me wellbrutin to counter that effect.  Genertic brand warning - auro gabapentin is a terrible , low effectiveness.  Apo is what I'm on.

I have taken many SSRIs, tricyclics, etc. that didnt help depression or anxiety.  Cognitive behavioral helped and  klonopin worked moderately, and thats all that worked.  I started Gabapentin at 100 mg 3 x a day.  I immediately noticed improvement and it also helped me feel more like not staying up late like I always do.  Klonopin is very helpful if you cant find relief in SSRIs & you dont have addictions, but for the first time Im hopeful that this Gabapentin might work. If it works even better at a higher dose Ill give it 10 stars. The only other thing that helped me a lot was l-methyl-folate.  I have the MTHFR gene mutation and the l-metal folate worked, but I had a side affect every time I took it.  I found a doctor that might be able to get rid of the side effect.  So after 40 years I now have 2 drugs other than klonopin that give me some hope.   SSRIs give me bad side effects but no positive results.

Completely ended my depression.  Also lets me sleep soundly.  Taking 600mg x3 a day.  Only slight side effects for the first two days - felt tired and a little loopy, but nothing that concerned me.  The depression I had was absolutely crippling.  No other medicine I tried even touched it.  Gabapentin completely took it away.  I feel incredible!

I tried this several years ago. 300mg, then 600mg, then 900mg a day in divided doses. I helps with nerve pain, but I had horrible dreams that led to anxiety which I was already having problems with, so it got worse. The dreams became so vivid I started wondering if they were dreams or actually happened and I just thought they were a dream. I'm not Bipolar, don't suffer from clinical depression, but do have GAD from chronic pain. Maybe I can try it again at lower doses, say start at 100mg once a day, then twice, then three times. I'm on clonazepam now 2mg X 2 a day for atypical facial neuralgia and anxiety due to a crushed trigeminal nerve and other pain issues including arthritis. I have tried EVERY medical pain option out there. Clonazepam works, but I am afraid it will lose it's potency over time. I run, lift weights, cycle, watch my diet and am in excellent general health at 60+.
Taking 500mg three times a day.  I was a complete mess before this miracle drug.  Now I no longer have anxiety or depression.  I have my life back.  It's amazing

Diagnosed bipolar and put on Lamictal. 1st panic attack sent me to ER at age 27. Had anxiety for 2 years. Doctor added Lexapro which eliminated all anxiety and panic attacks. In 2017 I had another panic attack that sent me to ER. My panic attacks felt like I was going to pass out and die. Doctor switched me to Paxil (40 mg) & Klonopin (1.5 mg) and continued to take Lamictal (300 mg). I continued to have milder panic attacks and anxiety which felt like I was being choked. I tried Buspar but didn't help. My doctor mentioned gabapentin so I came across this forum and gave it a shot. My doctor started me on 100mg 3 X's a day and I am 260 lbs. It totally eliminated all anxiety and panic. I can drive, live life without fear of having a panic attack or dealing with daily anxiety. There are zero side effects for me. I am off the Klonopin and carry it with me just in case. I eliminated ALL caffeine from my diet. Gabapentin has been a miracle drug for me and I hope it helps you too.

I was on Benzodiazepines for forty years. I found a psychiatrist to help me get off. I was also in pain from a spine injury. I have a good spine doctor and he worked with the psychiatrist. They thought gabapentin would serve a two fold purpose for nerve pain and anxiety and withdrawal. It worked. I took gabapentin for almost a year and I stopped for six months. I can't say I experienced any bad side effects from stopping but the nerve pain was back and withdrawal from Klonapin increased. I got into a funk and low grade depression and had existential crisis and felt detached from everything. I decided to try gabapentin again and I have to say it turned my situation around. It's been eight months and I'm doing much better with both anxiety and nerve pain. For me the benefits far outweigh any side effects which are minimal for me. I am much calmer, feel normal, not emotionally detached and beleaguered. I can't say that I have experienced any of the horror stories I've read.

After dealing with anxiety and depression for many years I started taking Gabapentin it is the best medication I have tried yet for anxiety tension and overall pain. I have been able to do so much while taking it.

It seems to be helping somewhat at 900 mg a day. I wish more folks here would specify the dosage. A lot of posts seem to be enthusiastic about this drug but I'd like to know how much to take - beyond the 900 mg's to feel a more profound, lasting effect
I started taking gabapentin for anxiety and it changed my life. It gave me a level of control in my life I never experienced before.

Hello Everone, Took forever to find a current forum on this drug  - this one is great. My Dr. prescribed me Gabapentin for about the past 3 months and I've been skipping several days a week because I'm worried to death from what I've read everywhere, that it wears off in time. My days that I don't  take it are very bad. Once I start daily, that's it, no turning back again. I don't want to face withdrawal when the time comes if won't continue working in 5 months, or 3 years etc. Just scared and so worried, that's why I am saving days for it to work well. If anyone here has searched like me, the internet is 95% nothing but very bad news on this medication. I don't know what to do..confused.

Amazing drug for anxiety, especially social anxiety. Whenever I take gabapentin I'm able to go out and socialize without problems. I've been taking this for 6 years. I never had any luck with any other drug, and I've tried so many. The only side affect I get with gabapentin is if you don't take it consistently you will get really depressed and angry. At least I do.

Wow this medication is a lifesaver. It got me off Klonopin instantly. It did something unusual for me. I have Bipolar disorder type 2 and depression has just been my daily thing. This medication not only took away anxiety it completely took the depression away. I am on lamictal too. I have been on so many medications its scary. None of them working. This one has just sucked away my depression as if it never existed. I am amazed and even though I dislike medication, this one is a miracle. I take 1800 mg divided three times a day
Saved my life. That's all I can say. I feel human again.

I first starting taking this medicine in summer of 2017 for anxiety and panic disorder to help me from taking so much klonopin.  I took 300mg 4x a day.   To be honest it did help for a while but I think it's just because it was making me high.  I know it doesn't directly affect gaba but it helps you detatch so you of course feel better. Over time it will lose its potency though and I just ended up more depressed  on it because it is a depressive drug.  Since January 2018, I have been tapering down from 4 a day to almost just one 300mg per day and I've lost 20 lbs and my suicidal thoughts have been drastically reduced.  I think this medication is probably good for short term use but overall not healthy to use for psychological reasons alone if you are prone to depressive thoughts or suicidal ideation.
Works better for my anxiety than klonopin and xanax.  Also puts me in a generally better mood.

I have been on gabapentin for years. I have severe withdrawals. I stopped taking it for awhile, thinking Im addicted, I went back on it because I wasnt doing anything. Just watching TV All day. Now I swim, walk, take care of dogs, etc. I realized it helps me with anxiety and depression.

Took 300mgs of Gabapentin today at 10:29am. Got really dizzy and my mouth felt a bit puffed up. But, I did not have that much anxiety. My anxiety makes my throat feel like it's going to close but when I took the gabapentin, I felt a lot better and now, at 5pm, my throat feels fine, my pain is gone and you know I feel a lot better. Supposed to be taking it 3 times a day. But, I am VERY scared of taking meds. But, once I found out gabapentin is a neurotransmitter and calms your nervous system, I felt better. Tired too. Maybe might get some sleep finally.
I have been on this medicine for 3 year's. I take 3200mg daily in divided doses.  I was put on it after I lost my husband to suicide in front of me.

Hey Im Troy I live in California. I dont know where to start so Ill just tell you what Ive been through and how this medication helped me. Ive been bullied since grade 5 about a multitude of things. My whole life (so far) Ive always felt different. Like I see things a lot differently than other people and I suffer from existential anxiety and severe anxiety. Always wondering why were here how we got here whats the meaning of life blah blah blah. Anyways, you get my point and maybe you even relate to me. Ive tried a bunch of medications to help me like: hydroxyzine, lexapro, abilify, adderall, strattera, Wellbutrin and a lot more I cant remember atm. Anyways Gabapentin - after taking it for two days has already changed my thoughts, and my actions this medication makes me feel extremely happy, outgoing, at ease, and just overall fine. My thoughts no longer take control of me and drive me insane. Thank you Neurontin.

You definitely feel weird and spaced out for a few days but that will go away once your body gets used to it.  I was prescribed 300mg 3X a day for pain. I also take OxyContin and Norco. It changed my whole life. My pain dr didnt know about the years I have suffered with PTSD, GAD and severe tension. To the point where my muscles in my upper back, shoulders, neck and back of my head, including my jaw would tense so much that I had constant headaches. So severe that I would vomit. This went on for years. I tried EVERYTHING! So little did I know that when dr added gabapentin, it would change everything. I got my first 8 hr sleep in over 20 years. It helped with all the pain. I started going for walks, cleaning my house and doing projects again. I feel amazing! So please give it a chance to work. I know it feels weird and icky for a few days but that does go away. Dont give up.

On 400mg three times a day.  Feel wonderful, but not drugged.  I feel normal.  No more anxiety or depression and I sleep 7 to 8 hours a night.  For the people saying gabapentin isn't working for them: it could be because your dose is too low.  I started at 100mg three times a day and it did nothing.  Went up to 300mg three times a day and felt better, but still anxious and wasn't sleeping well.  Went up to 400mg three times a day and it's working wonderfully.  Don't give up.  It's all about finding the right dose for you.  Some people need  a bigger dose three times a day to see results.  Plus, it took about a month before I noticed the full results of the drug.

My psychiatrist put me on it to help me sleep.  I have severe depression, anxiety, OCD and PTSD.  I am a veteran.  I have been on it for almost three months now, and I could not figure out what was wrong with me.  I do have occasional bouts of anger, but my anger issues have gotten out of control.  I find myself screaming and yelling at strangers, not to mention flipping drivers off.  In addition, I am having memory loss that is worse than before, and it does not help me sleep at all.  My depression is also 10 times worse.  I am just waiting to be assigned to a new VA (I just moved), and get off this stuff safely.  I take 900 mg a day (300 mg x 3 a night) for insomnia.

I've had really severe anxiety for over 10 years.  I've been prescribed Xanax,  Klonopin, antihistamines, etc.  The benzos somewhat worked.  Anything else didn't touch it.   When I say severe anxiety I mean tremors through my whole body,  fainting, shortness of breath, the works..  Finally,  someone suggested I try gabapentin.  It was the best decision I have ever made.   Since I've been taking 800mg twice a day  my whole life has changed.  I'm happy all the time, (I also suffer from depression and am currently taking an antidepressant that I can't spell lol), I have 50x more patience with my two young children,  I have motivation to get things done, I keep busy all day rather than moping around and avoiding the world.   This medication has changed my life and I highly recommend it to anyone who is suffering from severe anxiety or depression.
Somewhat effective. I was taking Klonopin for a few years, and was switched over. Gabapentin is very weak compared to Klonopin. I take 300mg 3x a day.

I took Gabapentin 300mg at night and found it made me drowsy so l had to go to bed by 9pm. I woke up having after having awful bad dreams and anxiety for hours so I dumped the pills in the trash. What garbage! Don't ever take this before driving or at work!

I absolutely love gabapentin. I was originally prescribed this for generalized anxiety disorder, but actually, it hits a few things on me at once. It calms my anxiety, helps my essential tremor, and soothes my restless legs syndrome. It's an essential and beneficial CNS med that I will happily take forever if need be. I do not experience any side effects whatsoever, although there was some dizziness when I first started taking it. I take 1800 mg per day.

I've had terrible depression and anxiety for over 20 years.  I was prescribed Paxil in 1995 and it worked great until last year.  It just stopped working and I had horrible rebound depression, anxiety, panic attacks and insomnia.  I felt really bad.. My CNP prescribed Gabapentin and I felt better after the first dose.  I take 300mg three times a day and feel wonderful.  No more anxiety, depression, constant worrying and it works great for insomnia.  The first night I took it, I slept 8 hours straight.  I haven't slept that well in over 30 years.  I had a few side effects such as slight dizziness and brain fog , but it passed in a few days. What's so great about it is it doesn't make me feel drugged.  I just feel calm, clear-headed and relaxed.  I can focus on the important things in my life and stop needlessly worrying about things such as what if I can't sleep tonight?  What if I go into Walmart and have a panic attack?. What if, what if.. This drug is truly a life saver for me.

I suffer from anxiety and severe PTSD. I was on Benzos for a long time but like so many was taken off due to long term risks. Gabapentin has taken care of my anxiety and traumatic flashbacks. A lot of my trauma was physical so I'll go through days where my entire body is in pain just out of cell memory. Gabapentin relieves the pain for me and helps me to stay in the present. The only side effect for me is extreme paranoia if I take more than 100mgs a day. I'm tiny and very sensitive to medication so low doses are more effective. I also take Lamictal daily which helps to counter any paranoia. This is just me though but I wanted to share my own experience. I was really apprehensive on trying Gabapentin because of all the scary reviews I read but I'm so happy I went on it. Everyone's brain chemistry is different. It's all about finding the right one for you.

I had great results with gabapentin. I am currently only on one drop a day. I am very sensitive to psychotropic drugs. So I asked for the liquid version. I am going to slowly increase my dose over time. It has lessened my anxiety and helped insomnia. Improved mood also.    Im afraid that some start on a big dose, have a reaction, then disregard the drug. It can be a reaction that your body is getting accustomed to the drug. Not that you cannot tolerate the drug. Obviously this wouldnt apply to allergic, anaphylactic reactions.     This wouldnt apply for epilepsy bc you need a standard dose. My issue is anxiety. So I dont absolutely have to have the drug. It helps for anxiety tho.

I was put on gabapentin as a last resort to my anxiety. I have not been able to function in society. I am a disabled veteran. I am in my second week now, and I am getting worried. I am so tired, but I can't sleep. I am not joking, I haven't slept for days now. I have dipped into extreme depression, and now I have uncontrollable shaking and twitching. I guess this is my entry to this med, and it really hurts. I am in contact about this situation with my med profs. They said it will take time for my body to adjust. For now though, I am very worried, this is not me.

Fantastic. Felt great and anxiety free the morning after taking it the previous evening.  Loads of energy. Did a lot of things that I previously had not done for a good while. Asked friends if they thought I might be high or euphoric  and they said no.

Been on Gabapentin past couple years for anxiety and social phobia. Recently, increased to 300mg three times per day. I've read everywhere about the withdrawal symptoms of it. It scares me a lot! I have been trying to take it every OTHER day but on the following day after, I really do feel depressed and anxiety is so bad, I can't leave my house.  A day later it lifts, and I start all over again. Does anyone else do it this way? I really am hesitant about taking it every day and having to one day perhaps face serious consequences of quitting it.

I have anxiety, pretty much generalized, that kicks my butt every couple years. It is bad and if it hangs around long enough I get very depressed. Insomnia too. I recently retired to a more rural coastal community and had to find a new Psychiatrist. I did but waited too long to see him. I was a wreck by the time I walked into his office for the first time.  Anyway, I had been taking Ativan prescribed by my GP but it wasnt working much and of course it can cause bounce back anxiety. My New Doc prescribed Gabapentin. He started me on baby doses of 100mg a day. I am now taking 100mg in am. 100mg mid day and 300mg at night. I feel so much better. I have not been taking any Ativan at all. No side effects except maybe a little euphoric. For sleep he prescribed Remeron which also did the trick and is not habit forming.

The only thing Gabapentin did for me was make me a zombie. It gave me horrible problems with balance, memory, and blurred vision. I also had a major problem finding words. My old doc refuses to hear it and would yell at me when I mentioned the gabapentin giving me side effects. I mentioned everything to my new doc and he decided to wean me off of the gabapentin and onto Ativan three times daily as well as a supplement called L-Theanine three times daily. The weaning process took about a week (I was taking 600mg gabapentin 3xD). I have never felt calmer, more sane, and more relaxed!! All of this without any balance, vision, or speech problems! Gabapentin is garbage! So glad to be free at last!
First day on Gabapentin first dose felt awesome. On 100mg 3x a day. Took second doing well! I finally hope and pray my feeling awesome continues.
Just started  to take for anxiety. No side effects noted.

I take 200 MG three times a day for Social and Generalized anxiety disorder, along with occasional panic. It works very well. I tried SSRI antidepressants before, but couldnt handle the side effects. Gabapentin works great!

I suffer from anxiety and was prescribed this versus my previous medication of Lexapro which didnt work for me at all. Within two days of taking this new medication gabapentin, I was almost in tears because of how spacey and uncomfortable I was. I was prescribed only 100mg to take once per night. I woke up the next morning feeling extremely spaced out and I felt stoned even though I wasnt. I couldnt process my thoughts correctly, I was forgetting how to do simple tasks and even losing short term memory when someone asked me to do job related tasks. I felt my eyes were very sleepy even though I had plenty of rest. While this helped ease my anxiety I noticed I was paranoid and noticed everything around me amplified. I was only on this medication for two days but thats all I needed to make me realize this wasnt helping me whatsoever.

My Doctor took me off a drug I have used for the last 5 years and put me on Gabapentin. This is just terrible made me feel worse  as I had all the side affects. Worst mistake ever to be on this if you have depression, anxiety,  can't sleep - this all intensified in me!!!  My Dr  didn't go over any side affects with me at all and my mistake for not asking  - a Big mistake!!! I was just a mess on this medication  I could not stop shaking, every thing got worse!! This is not something I ever want to go though again or see anyone else go though.

Gabapentin has changed my life! I've suffered from anxiety for over 15 years and have tried everything. I've been to many doctors and tried paxil, effexor, Zoloft, buspar, Attivan, and clonazepam. Antidepressants did not help me at all. The stronger drugs helped at first but my anxiety overwhelmed the drugs unless I was on a high dose and was just out of it. I didn't know what to do until a psychiatrist put me on gabapentin 300mg x3 daily. I can now live and do things almost like a normal person! Not one panic attack since I've started this medication(I was having them 2-3 tines a week.) At first I would get a little dizzy but it went away after a few days. If you are feeling hopeless please ask your doctor to try this medication. I'm so glad I have found it. I believe this drug could help a lot of people with anxiety!!
It's the only medication that works for me long term. I've had side effects with every medication besides Neurontin.

I have SEVERE PTSD from finding my Husband dead. Emergency services worked on him for 45 minutes.  This left me with severe anxiety, I was on Xanax for over a year. I've gone on gabapentin for extreme pain in my neck & back. I just looked up gabapentin for anxiety because I've noticed that I haven't been panicked at all since I've started taking it. I thought, if this isn't being prescribed for anxiety, it should be. Low & behold, it is.  My Dr wanted to start me on 300mg 3 times a day, but I asked for the lowest dose due to med sensitivity. I was prescribed 100mg 3 times a day. I've never felt better. I usually don't even take a 3rd pill. Pain I've been dealing w & taking thousands of mgs of other meds to attempt to relieve, is just gone.  As if that wasn't enough, I'm no longer panicked? My mind is just blown. I don't know if I'll have negative side effects, but w this level of quality of life being restored, I assume that any side effect may be well worth it. Miracle drug

Just started this prescription for anxiety. After taking it, it almost felt like a body buzz. I felt great. Zoned in, felt like I was moving at a better pace instead of slow and not engaged. My anxiety was the lowest I have felt in years. It was so relaxing to not feel anxious.

I  had an addiction problem for over 30yrs and when I finally came to my senses and wanted to stop methadone and subutex, I was prescribed Gabapentin,  I suffer from anxiety, depression and have recently been diagnosed as bipolar.  Over the years I have self medicated with everything and anything.  Taking Gabapentin really has been a miracle for me.  I no longer want illicit drugs, I feel relaxed, motivated and for the first time in many years happy.. I take three 300mg three times a day.  It can cause tummy problems and I generally have to take something once a week or so to stop this..  best medication I have ever had.  May not suit everyone
Didnt do much, if anything, for my anxiety. I didnt notice any side effects. I took 300mg 3x a day.

I first took this for nerve pain which worked  awesome but was pleasantly surprised to find  it worked for my anxiety also. About the only drug that ever did anything,  no SSRI's have ever worked for me.

I started taking Gabapentin five years ago for diabetic neuropathy in my feet.  Within a few days it zapped the shooting pains I experienced from the neuropathy.  Little did I realize the amazing effect it had in stablizing my moods.  It was only when I neglected to refill my script for a week (I'm lazy) that I realized what this med does to stablize my moods.  I fell into an absolute funk and couldn't figure out why until I put 2 +2 together.  Got the refill and the world was right again!  I have an overactive brain, and this med calms things down to a manageable pace.  Won't skip that refill again!

Absolutely amazing for dealing with Anxiety altogether, but specifically Social Anxiety. Not to mention Depression. I would have given it 10 stars if it didn't have such a quick tolerance factor. After about 3 consecutive days of taking it, it begins. The symptoms of Anxiety began returning slowly each day until you increase dosage. And that increase is way to frequent. The best way to deal with this down side isn't by increasing dosage every time, as that would take no time to reach unsafe dosages, but to not use it daily. If your going to use it for Anxiety purposes only, then only take it on the days your really struggling. Done this way, then it's a miracle drug for controlling Anxiety. Only side affect I experience is increase appetite

First day taking 300mg finally feel like myself again. After taking Xanax 4mg a day for 5 months, I stopped taking it but suffer from withdraws even after months of not taking Xanax. Ive been dealing with anxiety but this gabapentin made me finally feel like myself again, like before I even took Xanax. I was full of energy and no anxiety and its only first day!

I'm currently taking 3,000mg/day and feel much better about my anxiety. My side effects are minimal but they're there, so be forewarned. I'd recommend this medication to my family and friends for anxiety. My anxiety was uncontrolled with Xanax, ativan, lunesta/Zoloft, etc. I had tried almost everything, even being hospitalized 5 times. Gabapentin is finally what I needed all along.

Tried a bunch of different meds for PTSD and none seemed to work except the few hours Xanax may allow you. When I started GABA I was a bit loopy in the beginning and it was a bit weird. After a couple of weeks it went away and my anxiety went way down, it also seems to be most effective for 8-12 hrs. I take one 300 mg in the morning and one in the latter afternoon. I can see why it might not work for everyone as this is the only one that has worked for me. You have to give it a bit of time and at least for me the only side effect is lower anxiety.

I have had varying success with this drug. On one hand it has been a big help. It was able to flick the switch off and bring me out of a very bad GAD and major depressive episode.  But I wonder about the tolerance and how long it will be effective. I use it basically as an emergency tool when Im spiralling down the rabbit hole.
Hugely effective for first month. Some tolerance does develop eventually but overall still more effective than anything else I've taken.

I was on Doxepin 100mgs for a year, which worked incredibly for anxiety and insomnia. However, it caused delayed gastric emptying and never ending weight gain, so I ask my psych if I could try gabapentin due to the reviews here. Have been on 200mg/am and 300mg at night for a month, which is a low dose,  but has done nothing for my anxiety. Psych is starting me on Trazodone (again) for the anxiety but wants me to remain on the gabapentin because it does help with hot flashes, RLS, sleep, and surprisingly, controls my agitation. Dr wants to increase it quickly over the next two months to replace the Trileptal that I've been on several years as a mood stabilizer. I definitely think gabapentin has its place as a mood stabilizer for BP patients.

I suffer from depression and anxiety. I have been on Wellbutrin for three years and I love it. It actually helped a little with anxiety as well, but I would have situational panic attacks and although those situations are now past, I do feel low level anxiety most of the time and certain things can send me into a spiral of doomsday thinking, obsessive thoughts and fear. Once one situation passes, its on to something else.  I cant enjoy anything when Im in those cycles. Even a day off from work can be full of anxiety instead of relaxation. My doc prescribed Gabapentin at a low dose (100mg) three times a day. Took first last night and slept ok. Little groggy but coffee solved that. Hoping this works for me like it has for so many here.

This has been the best thing ever for anxiety. I have never been on an anxiety medicine, but my anxiety was getting uncontrollable so my doctor prescribed this. I was a little weary at first, but 3 weeks on this (300 mg/day) has truly changed my life! The little things I used to stress about, I no longer worry about and it also helps with sleep. Wouldn't recommend anything else!

This was a miracle for me!  I was taking alprazolam 3-4 times a day for about 4 years. With the crackdown of controlled substances, my PCP decided to wean me off. I have terrible anxiety. SSRI's do not work for me (too many side effects). After reading the reviews of gabapentin, I asked my PCP if we could try this. AMAZING!!! I no longer wake up shaky and anxious, I don't get that feeling  I used to get when the alprazolam wore off, and I sleep better than ever! I take 300 MG 3-4 times daily. This truly is a life saver for me!

I went through a benzodiazepine withdrawal back in 2013 and found that a low dose 200 mg of Gabapebtin helped me back then. I was on benozos 30 years and no longer use them for 4 years straight now. I went off all drugs on principal four years ago but after four years and major anxiety and depression I decided to use Gabapentin starting two weeks ago. It was not a easy choice as I realized that once on the drug Gabapentin I would most likely use it for many years as it is not so easy to get off of it and would need tapering. This drug has been amazing and I have not felt this good in years. I will continue to use it and may increase the dose from 600 mg a day to 900 mg a day. It has been alive saver. I highly recommend this drug for anxiety
Seriously the best for anxiety. I've been through countless SSRI's, buspar, Ativan, xanax, etc and gabapentin has worked better than all those combined for my anxiety and panic attacks.

After going through some major crisis in my life, my Provider and I tried a few antidepressants to help me cope with severe anxiety.   Zoloft, prozac, effexor, etc.  We also tried some Benzos, but nothing seemed to work until I stumbled upon Gabapentin  (Neurontin).  A low dose seemed to work for me....around 300mg / day.  It changed my life.

I have been using Gabapentin (300 mg twice daily) for about a month now, and I am very happy with it. I had been plagued by anxiety for most of my life (I'm 47 now), and my anxiety reached intolerable levels in the last year or so due to a very demanding new job. I finally decided I needed some sort of medication, and after trying Wellbutrin (thumbs down), I asked for Gabapentin. This med is doing exactly what I needed it to do: it is reducing my fears, uncontrollable worries, and hair-trigger adrenaline response to almost zero. Those bad feelings are down to like 2 out of 10, and before it was usually like 8 or 9.  Wish I'd started taking it a long time ago!

I was prescribed gabapentin for anxiety about a month ago. The first day I felt better than I have in a long time, but every day since then has been more hellish than the last. It is a clear day 1 was a fluke. Not only is the drug not working for me, it seems to actually be making me worse. (My husband noticed this as well, it's not in my head.)

When I first tried it I thought it helped my anxiety. Could have been a Placebo effect. After three or four days I wasn't sure it worked for me. When it did work, I felt really strange on it. Not a good feeling. I've tried it several more times and again I wasn't sure if it worked or not as I usually become more relaxed in the evening. I'm glad to see it works for many as it's better to use this then a Benzo that can really mess you up.

I first started to take Gabapentin as an off-label treatment for severe anxiety and OCD. While it did calm my intrusive thoughts a little, it in turn made me experience insomnia. I tried supplements and natural sleep aids to try to help me get to sleep at night but to no avail. Due to lack of sleep and perhaps the Gabapentin I began to feel depressed so I got off of it. It may work for others but for me it wasn't very effective for anxiety or OCD.

I agree Gabapentin is the only thing that  has help with my anxiety, I tried others medications but it don't work. I'm just taking it as needed for my anxiety and help me sleep. You can't just stop it like that. You have to weaned yourself off it. My anxiety got worse when I lost my mother in 2014. I wish everyone the best. You do what works for you. Everybody is different.

I've suffered from bouts of severe anxiety since I was 5 years old. I'm 44 now. The Dr put me on Xanax, but that never seemed to do much for me except finally let me sleep for a few hours if I took more than my prescribed dosage. I also have degenerative disc disease in my lower back & was put on Gaba for nerve pain about a year ago. I couldn't believe the effect it had on the anxiety. It's like it snips some internal wire a)& cuts the anxiety off. It's been a life saver for me, literally. HOWEVER, I say this with a warning. Obviously, not everyone gets this effect from Gaba. And, when I tried stopping cold turkey once, the anxiety came back worse than ever - like super bad.  So, it's a long term commitment, be aware.

I have been taking Ativan for 2 years first 0.5mgs. 3x/day for a year, then .5mgs. 2x/day for a year and now .5mgs. 1/day since January 2017. I have anxiety and panic attacks due to health issues. To help me withdraw from Ativan I was prescribed 100mg. of Gabapentin 2x/day. I was noticing no change in my anxiety. My Dr insisted 100mg. was a very low dose and I needed to experiment with taking more. Due to migraines and the use of Imitrex I can't take anti-depressants, else you might get  seratonin syndrome.  Ativan is a nightmare drug to get off of ... don't start! Today I took 200mgs. of Gabapentin and haven't taken any Ativan ... I actually felt better ... I have thoroughly enjoyed all the positive posts. My goal is to get off all meds ...

I've tried other drugs to treat my anxiety and depression with no luck. With gabapentin I'm able to function more normally. Gabapentin works for me where other drugs did not. For me it also improves my ability to multitask. I can concentrate and zone in on the task at hand. A welcome side effect is that smoking while the gabapentin is active makes me sick... I'm trying to use that as a way to quit. Also I occasionally lose balance and get the munchies, similar to cannabis. Please hear me... if you need help and have tried other drugs without help, try gabapentin. I still suffer but it provides me with the ability to function. It may also work for you.

I was just prescribed Gabapentin for anxiety coming off of alcohol. I'm taking Antabuse also, so since booze isn't an option and the doc won't prescribe a bento, I had to try his recommendation. I'm prescribed 2 x 300mg a day. Day 1, an hour after I took my first, felt like I was on a low dose of adderall more than a relaxer. Slight tremble in my hands, very talkative. Day 2, I took the morning dose and a cup of coffee. 2 hours later, I started getting shocks (not brain zaps), but shocks like I felt I might have a seizure. Told the doc, said impossible it's related. Took my evening dose. An hour later, super irritable, trouble walking, very dizzy. Stopped the Med.

I have pretty severe social anxiety, always have. I have tried a lot of SSRI as well as other drugs over the years. Gabapentin is the only drug that makes me feel at ease. I also take small amounts of Xanax before situations that make me especially nervous. I find that Gabapentin changes my personality somewhat though. I get angry, have paranoid thoughts and tend to believe unrealistic things, and generally care about everything less (which is good and bad). It can be difficult to maintain motivation and concentration to get necessary tasks completed. I have a job in which I have to interact with people a lot and even hold meetings. The positive effects of the gabapentin really make the negative effects tolerable.

I started Gabapentin 7 days ago taking 200mg twice per day. My GAD is worst in the morning and slowly subsides as the day goes on. I also stopped Valium 7 days ago. After many years of using benzos I decided it was enough as I'm sure it was just making my anxiety worse and certainly wasn't helping. Gabapentin has helped me and I feel a lot better than when I was on Valium. I don't know if I'm getting Valium withdrawal effects since it's only been 1 week or side effects from Gabapentin. Feel some nausea, light headed and my breathing is heavy. Overall better and can manage.

When I read all the glowing reviews for this med, my hopes skyrocketed...I thought, finally, I've found the promised land relative to treating my anxiety.  After being on the medication for a week now, I confidently say that I have had zero benefit from gabapentin. Maybe others had less acute anxiety, but for me, this drug did nothing.  Wanted to share this with those thinking of switching to this med, as my advise is to keep your expectations low so you don't get disappointed.

I've been using gabapentin for anxiety along with lamictal for bipolar type 2. Before the gabapentin I was on vistaril. I didn't like the way vistaril made me feel during my attacks and gabapentin has made it so much easier to manage throughout the day and even the attacks aren't as bad. I also have PTSD and it's made it a lot easier to function. I take one 100mg capsule three times a day.

I have had GAD ever since I can remember and I am 31 now. NOTHING and I mean NOTHING helped. My anxiety was so extreme, every minute of every day I was consumed with it. I had severe panic attacks and would sometimes faint. Gabapentin has been life changing for me. I have been on it for 3 months and my GAD is almost gone. I still have panic attacks at night, but this medication has been a miracle for me and I am and would definitely recommend trying it, specially if you are not responsive to 'normal' anxiety medications.

After going through hell using anti depressants I finally went to a specialist for anxiety. She did a DNA test to see what drugs would best work for me. I take one Clonazepam along with a Gabapentin in the am and then a second Gabapentin in the afternoon. It truly has been a life saver for me when nothing else worked for PSTD/anxiety. No side effects whatsoever. Be very careful with alcohol. Instead of three beers make it one.
Very good for anxiety. reflects many modes of anxiety BUT... this drug  may give you panic attack and restless leg syndrome (Which is weird as this drug is used to treat restless leg syndrome)

I took 1200 mg of gabapentin for a year for anxiety after stopping  citalopram and diazepam. It had no effect at all. I felt the same before I started it, when I was on it, and after I had stopped it. It didn't even have side effects. It did nothing. I have been on numerous SSRI'S, Seroquel, lithium, Lamictal and benzos for bipolar 2 with episodes of depressive/anxiety. Thankfully, the government disability insurance paid for gabapentin and not me.

I take 300 mg 3x a day and I feel the best I've felt in 10 years. Nothing has worked to calm my anxiety like Gabapentin including Klonopin or Xanax. I'm happy, relaxed, motivated and most importantly my appetite for alcohol which I used excessively to calm my anxiety has completely disappeared. I hope I can take this medication for forever. Life is finally good again.

I had pretty bad anxiety. My Doctor said to take 300mg of Gabapentin three times a day. The first time I took it was at night, before bed. It made me a little drunk feeling or maybe dopey. But, not a bad feeling. Not dizzy, not falling down - no other side effects. Made me a little sleepy to help with my insomnia. Next day - took 300mg at 9:00 a.m. - no problems, no side effects, nothing. Just anxiety relief. Once in a while I can feel the anxiety after about 6 hours when I need to take another pill. Started taking 600mg at bed time to help with sleep. The first time I raised the dose, it made me a little more tired and a little tipsy feeling. But only once. For anxiety, this stuff worked great for me with no side effects!!!

I started talking 600 mg three times a day for anxiety. It has done wonders. I used to have really bad anxiety when driving. I no longer have it. I also have really bad social anxiety. Now.... I sometimes can't stop talking to everyone.  lol The only downside is I feel a little weak and sleepy sometimes. Which makes it hard having a toddler.

I have been suffering from the anxiety for the past four years. I  have been on Ativan, Xanax, and many SSRI drugs. Nothing helped. As a matter fact, the SSRI drugs made my anxiety worse. Finally a psychiatrist prescribed gabapentin. It has been a miracle for me. I don't have any side effects whatsoever. All of the physical symptoms of anxiety (heart palpitations, shortness of breath, sweating, tiredness) have disappeared. I I also feel more even. I have more patience and I'm not in such a rush to do things. I take three 300 mg pills a day. I am so thankful for finding this drug. I know how hard it is to try different medications and have them not work.  I hope anybody who is suffering from anxiety finally finds a medication that helps.

After a 4 day hospitalization for anxiety and to reduce prescription drug usage I was disturbed by the zombifying drugs I was prescribed (Trazodone, Abilify, Lithium).  I'd been having a very hard time leaving my house and answering the phone.  I was eventually prescribed Gabapentin while I continued to titrate off of Xanax.  While I've started craving sweets and drinking sodas ( I ate an entire cake in 24 hours) I am feeling much better.  It does not, however, help me sleep.  I try to take my last dose before 6pm.  I experimented last night and took it right before bed and I woke up every couple of hours.  I have unusual reactions to meds and  adjust my expectations and understanding of side effects. This is a helpful drug for anxiety.

I've had Anxiety since I was a little child 6 yrs old to be exact. So over the years ( I'm 56 now) I've also developed PTSD, OCD Depression And recently agoraphobia..under a former Drs Orders because I'm such a severe case I was prescribed 4mg of xanax and 4mg of Klonopin along with 10/325 hydrocodone 5 times a day for severe neck and back pain from bulging discs causing spinal stenosis all throughout from my neck all the way down to my lumbar spine. Already had spinal fusion at L5S1. I ended up overdosing when he added Percocet. I found a new Dr.and he weaned me safely off of everything and now I'm taking 2400 mg of Gabapentin  it has been a miracle. Best med by far for my Anxiety. Sill need neck surgery but my Anxiety has left the bldg.
This medication made me really down . It was completely ineffective for my neuropathy. I would highly recommend that no one take this medication.

This medication was working for my anxiety but never really made it go away. My psychiatrist kept insisting raising dosage since was only taking 200mg at night & 200mg in morning. So I started taking 300mg at night for a week and woke up completely disoriented with the whole room moving, vomiting, falling down. I couldn't even sit anymore or lift head without falling backwards and would throw up in the car (someone had to drive me to doc) All these symptoms are so horrible with anxiety. I lowered dose back to 200mg that day 2 times a day. It's been 5 days and still have symptoms. Be careful with this med. I never had symptoms before the increase.

So I started taking gaba 2 years ago for anxiety but yet I became more and more of an alcoholic. I did not even know that this medication was for that. Now I went to the doctor and am on other meds and gaba is making me a to talk backwards, forget with in minutes and disoriented . I sleep ill noon and then run into things. My doctor didn't think he should mention this but the pharmacist did. I have a child. Please do your research.

I have been on gabapentin and prozac for 18 months now and seem to be tolerating it well. I was taking a Effexor before, and having problems. Coming off of Effexor shot my GAD through the roof and I ended up in hospital. Bad scene. They don't prescribe benzodiazepines for long term use anymore, but gabapentin seems to be working, and with less side effects.
I've been on this medication for about two weeks, I take  150mg twice a day so 300mg a day. At first I slept a lot! but it really does help with my generalized anxiety.

I've been suffering from Anxiety, nervousness and depression for the last 6 years. I've taken 150mg Zoloft for 8 weeks and while my depression is OK, my anxiety is still there. I take 125mg Trazadone to help me sleep. I'm tapering down my diazepam (valium) which first helped but  than made me worse. I just started Gabapentin 3 days ago.The first day I took 100mg and it really relaxed me, even better than any benzo can now. Side effects are blurred vision, dizziness and weakness. Hope these will go away in the next two weeks.

I started off on 100mg for anxiety for 6 months now my doctor bumped it up to 600mg a day.... It doesn't work for my aniexty It works good for my nerve pain in hands, legs, arms.... It's not a good Medicine for anxiety

Day 1 , I am 27 type 1 diabetic diagnosed 2 years ago I live on my own I feel let down a lot with how the NHS prolongs people's misery unknowingly of course. I'm not saying they are bad , they are angels, a lot of them have saved my life a few times I owe a lot to them . I have had the most excruciating pain in chest, body, back, arms, legs, toes, fingers, head you name it. I have had pain in all forms like stabbing burning aching pounding for months on end, not thinking clea,r having endless plans of how I'm going to turn everything around, but I would never be able to due to pain anxiety attacks and nerve pain. I felt hopeless until today I got the point across to my doctor and he gave me gabapentin omg I've rebooted I'm non stop moving and achieving. Yay

Just started taking gabapentin.  Nervous about taking it .  Have been taking it for one week.  Currently taking 100 mg 2 x daily. Not sure if it is working.  Reassured by positive feedback on this site but part of my problem is fear about taking pills.   How long before you start to feel comfortable with this med?

For the last 7 years I have had severe anxiety, panic attacks, and insomnia. I was given remeron for sleep and klonopin for anxiety. Recently my pdoc and I decided it's time for me to get off the benzos. She gave me gabapentin and it's been a life saver. I'm doing well at gradually tapering off klonopin. The only drawback I find is that gabapentin wears off rather fast, and your body builds up a tolerance really fast. Been on it for 3 months now. I started at 100mg 3 times a day. Within a month I was up to 300mg 3xdaily and 600mg at night. Currently I am only taking it PRN at 300mg. As someone who has tried every mood stabilizer and anxiety medication  under the sun. Gabapentin is amazing!

When I first took this drug it was amazing almost seemed as though I were tapping into the right side of my pain crazy right. I Love Love Love it, but seems like it started  wearing off so took larger dose worked but again wore off. Don't know what the answer is. But It was an awesome drug bless the day they started it to us anxiety people.........
They help with my stress. And calm down my restless legs a lot. Make me a little drowsy.
This medication has worked wonders for me..it changed my life I was a the verge of suicide. It brought me out of my shell and now I'm going back to school and doing well..thanks to this medication.

My doctor put me on this to help with my anxiety symptoms which include tight and sore jaw, tight and sore shoulders and tight and sore stomach. Not only did it take all that away, it helps me to sleep. I used to sleep great and didn't have these anxiety symptoms before my gastric sleeve surgery but ever since, I am developed insomnia and these anxiety symptoms. This has been a life saver for me!

I'm diagnosed MDD & Bipolar, Type 2, and this is the first medication I've taken that has a significant positive impact on my anxiety without bad side effects. I usually worry, have circular negative thought patterns, and feel awkward and lost in my head most of the day. But I've gone from 300mg to 400mg and now to 600 mg of generic gabapentin, and it works wonderfully. It doesn't make me sleepy, unlike benzos. Like quite a few people, I've abused benzos in the past, but rarely get an urge to take too many gabapentin because of the limited recreational use. In conclusion: in my opinion, gabapentin is a wonder-drug for anxiety; especially for addicts and/or those with bipolar disorder.

In 2009 I was nearly crippled by severe general anxiety disorder and have taken xanax every single day of my life since. In the past year, through the use of regular yoga and meditation, I have weaned back to 1mg/day. However, I could never really sleep deeply and I could not go a night without xanax. I would basically get no sleep at all. Even with it, I would often wake up at 4am and need to take more. Two months ago I was prescribed duloxetine. I take it at bedtime and it helps, but it never really shut off that buzzing anxiety in the background of my brain. So doc started me on gabapentin and I have been sleeping like a baby and slowly reducing the xanax. It's even helped some with my fibromyalgia.
Gabapentin saved me from anxiety and I inadvertently weaned off of klonopin while on it. I love it. Improved my quality of life significantly!
Gabepen has turned me inton a ZOMBIE. I have kidney disease and never should had  been prescribed this medication.

In a chemical dependancy program, suffered from anxiety and insomnia. Gabapentin saved my life. 300mg, 3X a day. 50mg of seroquel at night for sleep. I finally feel normal for the first time since my early 20's. I am 42.  Best sleep ever, deep sleep, full dreams. Gabapentin made me feel a bit foggy for the first 2 weeks, but after settling in, I function fine, with normal energy and normal reactions to life. It has stabilized my appetite as well, I have actually lost 20 pounds in the past 6 weeks.
It seems to work for generalized anxiety when taken in large doses twice a day (for me anyway). It does seem to cause weight gain though.

I think Gabapentin works better than benzodiazepines. I do not like taking benzos because they make me sleep. Gabapentin does relax me believe it or not I don't know about you but it does work for me. Of course for some reason I have to take more than 300 mg for it to relax me but it does work. And it doesn't make me sleepy but it does make me hungry LOL. I prefer Gabapentin or Neurontin over benzodiazepines.

I WAS GIVEN GABAPENTIN FOR ANXIETY ABOUT  SIX MONTHS AGO AND BEGAN TO HAVE SIDE EFFECTS  VERY SOON. HIGHEST DOSE WAS 300MG THREE TIMES PER DAY.  WAS TAKEN TO HOSPITAL SIX WEEKS AGO WITH SYMPTOMS OF A HEART ATTACK. AN ANGIOGRAM WAS DONE AND RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE BUT THE CHEST AND ARM PAINS EVEN FOOLED THE CARDIO PEOPLE. HEART DOCTOR TOLD ME TO STOP GABEPENTIN IMMED. I have been tapering for five weeks and it has been awful. PLEASE DON'T USE THIS DRUG

I had a severe traumatic brain injury (TBI) in 2006, since then we have tried multiple medications to control Anger.  Depakote,  Topamax, Klonapin, Zoloft etc etc.   None of them worked .  I have been in rages to where I don't want to be around anyone or talk. It's been 10 years now and I happened to go to a doctor in a small town and told her everything about my anger etc . She prescribed Gabapentin along with Cymbalta and I have felt the greatest change. I go outdoors and hike, fish , feel like I am living again. Still I will have my bad days but this medicine I highly recommend to people who suffer with anger/irritability.   I completely understand that we are all different and medicines work differently and I truly hope the best for you reading this.
Quick relieve from anxiety improved mood and more productivity. Love it.
So far works better than anything else I've tried for social anxiety

I have been through many mental health diagnosis and double the amount in meds.
